definition: fire/speculum/to obtain fire by drilling wood, striking flint, sun's rays etc
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]

sentences.english: A narrow and flinty grand rue wound up a short incline.
sentences.chinese: 一燧石鋪成的窄道在這短斜坡上蜿蜒上升。

sentences.english: Flintstone’s complete vitamins were also tested and passed.
sentences.chinese: 燧石公司全部的維他命都經過測試並通過。

sentences.english: The watercourse is lined in raw flint nodules, used as it is found in the ground.
sentences.chinese: 水道由在地面收集到的生燧石砌成。

sentences.english: An obsolete gunlock using flint and a revolving wheel.
sentences.chinese: 用燧石和旋轉輪的廢棄的手槍。

sentences.english: If the first stroke of the flint doth not bring forth the fire, you must strike again.
sentences.chinese: 如果第一擊不能叫燧石發出火來，你就當再擊一次。

sentences.english: She studies flint-knapping — the art of making stone tools the way our ancestors did.
sentences.chinese: 她研究燧石敲擊術，一門我們的祖先製造石器的手藝。

definition: brass (alloy of copper 銅|铜[tong2] and zinc 鋅|锌[xin1])
